Detailed Description

The Power Domain Manager (PDM) is a component of Power Management (PM) software which helps in putting a particular power domain to the different power states, reading the current and the last power states in which the power domain is present.
The PDM also allows the user to set the supported Logic and memory retention states in which the power domain logic and memory should be put in.
The PDM HAL API would not retain any state which would record which power domain is being configured for what state.
The HAL does not provide any sequencing with respect to powering down a given module. It only provides the abstraction for register access.

Function Documentation

int32_t PMHALPdmGetConfiguredLogicRetState ( pmhalPrcmPdId_t  pdId,
pmhalPrcmPdLogicRetState_t *  logicState 
)

This API reads the Logic retention state configured when the PD is retention.

Parameters
pdIdUnique ID of the power domain.
logicStateLogic retention state is populated in this field. Refer enum pmhalPrcmPdLogicRetState_t for details.
Returns
Status of the API call. Can be any of the following
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the logicState read is successful.
  • PM_BADARGS Indicates the logicState read is not successful and the pdId is incorrect or register is not supported or logicState is NULL.
int32_t PMHALPdmGetConfiguredLowPwrStateChange ( pmhalPrcmPdId_t  pdId,
pmhalPrcmPdLowPwrStateChangeType_t *  lowPwrReq 
)

This API reads the low power change request field.

Parameters
pdIdUnique ID of the power domain.
lowPwrReqLow Power Request is populated in this field. Refer enum pmhalPrcmPdLowPwrStateChangeType_t for details.
Returns
Status of the API call. Can be any of the following
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the lowPwrReq read is successful.
  • PM_BADARGS Indicates the lowPwrReq read is not successful and the pdId is incorrect or lowPwrReq is NULL.
int32_t PMHALPdmGetConfiguredMemRetState ( pmhalPrcmPdId_t  pdId,
pmhalPrcmPhyMemBankId_t  memBankId,
pmhalPhyBankRetStates_t *  memoryRetState 
)

This API reads the configured memory bank status when the power domain is in retention.

Parameters
pdIdUnique ID of the power domain.
memBankIdUnique ID of the memory bank.
memoryRetStateThe memory bank power state when the PD is in RET is populated here. Refer enum pmhalPhyBankRetStates_t for details.
Returns
Status of the API call. Can be any of the following
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the memoryRetState read is valid.
  • PM_BADARGS Indicates the memoryRetState read is not valid and the pdId is incorrect or the pointer to memoryRetState is NULL or the memory bank does not belong to the power domain.

pmhalPrcmPdState_t *  pdState 
)

This API reads the power state configured for the power domain (PD)

Parameters
pdIdUnique ID of the power domain.
pdStateThe power domain state is populated in this argument. Refer enum pmhalPrcmPdState_t for details
Returns
Status of the API call. Can be any of the following

  • PM_BADARGS Indicates the pdState read is not successful and the pdId is incorrect or register is not supported.
pmErrCode_t PMHALPdmGetCpuResetId ( pmhalPrcmPdId_t  pdId,
pmhalPrcmModuleId_t  modIdx,
pmhalPrcmResetGroupId_t  cpuResetId[PMHAL_PRCM_NUM_CPU_RESETS_FOR_SUBSYSTEM],
uint32_t *  numResetsReturned 
)

This API finds the corresponding CPU reset for a given CPU Subsystem.

Parameters
pdIdUnique ID of the power domain.
modIdxModule Id of the desired module.
cpuResetIdArray which would hold the reset IDs of the CPU resets for a given CPU subsystem.
numResetsReturnedGives the number of CPU resets returned.
Returns
status Status of the operation.
  • PM_SUCCESS - Indicates if the CPU reset IDs are returned correctly.
  • PM_BADARGS - If the Array and the numResetsReturned is NULL.
int32_t PMHALPdmGetCurrLogicStatus ( pmhalPrcmPdId_t  pdId,
uint32_t *  logicOn 
)

This API reads the current power domain logic power status.

Parameters
pdIdUnique ID of the power domain.
logicOnThe PD logic power status is populated here. 1 - If logic is ON, 0 - If logic is OFF.
Returns
Status of the API call. Can be any of the following
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the logicOn read is valid.
  • PM_BADARGS Indicates the logicOn read is not valid and the pdId is incorrect or the pointer to logicOn is NULL.

Returns
resetId Reset group Id of the corresponding module.
int32_t PMHALPdmGetPDTransState ( pmhalPrcmPdId_t  pdId,
uint32_t *  pdInTransition 
)

This API reads the power domain transition status.

Parameters
pdIdUnique ID of the power domain.
pdInTransitionThe flag of whether the PD is in transition is populated in this field. 1 - If PD in transition, 0 - If not.
Returns
Status of the API call. Can be any of the following
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the pdInTransition read is valid.
  • PM_BADARGS Indicates the pdInTransition read is not valid and the pdId is incorrect or the pointer to pdInTransition is NULL.
int32_t PMHALPdmSetLastPDStatus ( pmhalPrcmPdId_t  pdId,
pmhalPrcmPdState_t  pdState 
)

This API writes to the last power status of the power domain. This API is mainly used to clear the last entered power status.

Parameters
pdIdUnique ID of the power domain.
pdStateThe last power domain state is populated in this argument. Refer enum pmhalPrcmPdState_t for details.
Returns
Status of the API call. Can be any of the following
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the pdState write is valid.
  • PM_BADARGS Indicates the pdState write is not valid and the pdId is incorrect or the value of pdState is wrong.

  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the memoryRetState write is successful.
  • PM_BADARGS Indicates the memoryRetState write is not valid and the pdId is incorrect or the memory bank does not belong to the power domain.
int32_t PMHALPdmSetPDState ( pmhalPrcmPdId_t  pdId,
pmhalPrcmPdState_t  pdState,
uint32_t  timeout 
)

This API write to the power state for the power domain (PD)

Parameters
pdIdUnique ID of the power domain.
pdStateThe power domain state is populated in this argument. Refer enum pmhalPrcmPdState_t for details
timeoutRequired timeout for which the API should wait for the power domain to go to the desired state.
  • PM_TIMEOUT_NOWAIT - The API does not wait.
  • PM_TIMEOUT_INFINITE - The API waits till the power domain transition happens. If it does not happen the API waits infinitely for the power domain to reach the desired state. Any other value - The API waits to any one of the events to happen first :
    (1)(Success)Power domain reaches the desired state.
    (2)(Failure)The timeout is reached but no power domain state change.
Returns
Status of the API call. Can be any of the following
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the pdState write is successful.
  • PM_BADARGS Indicates the pdState write is not successful and the pdId is incorrect or register is not supported or the pdState value is invalid.
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the time out is reached and the power domain did not change to the desired value.
